title: Solving the Antiderivative
text: We have $$\frac{d}{dx} e^x=e^x$$. Thus, $$F(x)=e^x$$ is an antiderivative of $$e^x$$.
speech: We have  fraction, d over, d x,  e to the x-th is equal to, e to the x-th . Thus,    f of x is equal to, e to the x-th  is an antiderivative of  e to the x-th .
